speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: Previously on The X-Files...

speaker: SCULLY
line: It appears to be a craft; its skin covered with the intricate symbols you and I both saw. They are somehow imbued with power.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: There's activity in the temporal lobe we've just never seen. His brain is going to just die.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's causing this?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: It's a temporal lobe abnormality. That's how you're able to read minds.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's causing this is alien.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder I want to help you.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: You asked me to come down here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're going to inject him?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: He's being given the wrong treatment.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're not a doctor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, I know you've been compromised. I know Krycek is threatening your life.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I know you know about me-- that my loyalties aren't just to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's not dying. He is more alive than he's ever been and what's causing it may be extraterrestrial.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Please, Mulder. Hold on.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: We've exhausted all medical and scientific evidence. By that I mean nothing we can find -- no disease, no hint of disease, only symptoms. The brute fact is he's experiencing so much activity in his temporal lobe that it is effectively destroying his brain.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: Enough. There's only so much bluntness a mother can take.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: I'm sorry. I just...

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: All you do is sedate him. You're turning him... into a zombie.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: I know you can hear me, Fox. Can you give me a sign?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can hear you, Mom.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom, I can hear you. I'm here.

speaker: TEENA MULDER
line: I love you, my darling boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom, where you going? Mom! Mom! Come back, Mom! Mom! Mom!! Mom!!!

speaker: CSM
line: "When in disgrace with fortune and men's eyes." Ah, but your mummy will still love you. All a mother wants is to shield her boy from pain and danger. Safe in the world as he was once in the womb. But maybe we think a father demands more than mere survival. Maybe we're afraid a father demands worldly adulation, success, heroism... I know you can hear me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I could always hear you. Even when my mind is jammed with a thousand voices I can hear you like a snake hissing underneath. How the hell did you get in here?

speaker: CSM
line: How does anything I do surprise you now? Aren't you expecting me to sprout vampire fangs?

speaker: MULDER
line: You've come to kill me.

speaker: CSM
line: It would be better than living like a zombie, wouldn't it?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm giving you a choice.

speaker: MULDER
line: What choice?

speaker: CSM
line: Life or death. Your account is squared -- with me, with God, with the IRS, with the FBI. Rise out of your bed and come with me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm dying, you idiot. If I could get up, I'd kick your ass.

speaker: CSM
line: Don't be so dramatic. Only part of you is dying. The part that played the hero. You've suffered enough - for the X-Files, for your partner, for the world. You're not Christ. You're not Prince Hamlet. You're not even Ralph Nader. You can walk out of this hospital and the world will forget you. Arise.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wh... wh... what the hell are you doing to me?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm showing you how to take the road not taken. Take my hand.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why should I take your hand?

speaker: CSM
line: You can't read my mind?

speaker: MULDER
line: No... I can't. All the voices are gone.

speaker: CSM
line: Take my hand, Fox. You have to take the first step.

speaker: CSM
line: Take my hand. I am your father.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Sleep is a luxury, Agent Scully. A self-indulgence we have no time for. Nor does Agent Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you get in here?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Getting in is easy. It's what you do once you're inside that's key.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: You are the only one with access to Mulder. I need you to use it wisely.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like you? Almost killing him by shooting him full of Phenytoin for a few moments of lucidity.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: It's what Agent Mulder wanted. He knows what's wrong. What he wants now is to prove it. It's why he asked for me, not you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe that.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Two years ago your partner was infected with a virus he claimed was alien. A virus reactivated in him by exposure to a source of energy also alien. Agent Mulder is living proof of

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, whatever it is, it's killing him. And we have to get it out of him.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: You destroy this and I'll destroy you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, you need to go to the hospital.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why? What happened?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder's gone. He's disappeared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There were guards posted here. A man who's gravely ill doesn't just get up and disappear.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I know. I know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did this happen?

speaker: SKINNER
line: His mother checked him out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His mother?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's what they're saying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Has anybody spoken with her?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm leaving that up to you. It's better I not be involved any further in this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, this isn't just a case. This is Agent Mulder we're speaking about.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And I am trying to help him by staying out of this from now on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir!

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm in a compromised position. The less I know about Agent Mulder's whereabouts and yours the better.

speaker: BOY IN CIGARETTE SMOKING MAN'S VOICE
line: The child is father to the man.

speaker: CSM
line: You've been asleep quite a while. I expect it'll be some time before your sleep patterns return to normal. Would you like an explanation?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure.

speaker: CSM
line: While you were lying unconscious in the hospital this afternoon my doctors worked on you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: CSM
line: At some point I realized that if the Syndicate didn't kill you the FBI would. If the FBI didn't kill you your own misguided heroism would. There's really no way out for you. There's no way for you to cheat death except by disappearing.

speaker: MULDER
line: A man can't just disappear.

speaker: CSM
line: Oh, we've made entire cultures disappear. Like me, now, you'll... you'll become a man without a name. But even while you miss your former identity, you'll... you'll learn to love life's simpler pleasures.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that'll be kind of tough with these on.

speaker: CSM
line: When you no longer want to run, those will come off. How do you feel?

speaker: MULDER
line: I feel better than I did. I've got to tell Scully. I've got to tell her.

speaker: CSM
line: If you do have contact with her you'll put her in danger. You're entering a kind of, uh, witness protection program, for want of a better term.

speaker: CSM
line: Can I offer you a cigarette?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't smoke.

speaker: CSM
line: Maybe now you do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't move. Who's there?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: I don't mean to frighten you. Albert Hosteen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here? How did you get here?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: I'm sorry to surprise you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Surprise? That you're standing here. The last time I saw you was in New Mexico. They'd taken you from the hospital. Your... your doctors feared the worst.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: I was hoping to see your partner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's missing.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You must save him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's very ill.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You must find him before something happens not only for his sake-- for the sake of us all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are we?

speaker: CSM
line: Home. This is your new life.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't understand.

speaker: CSM
line: You can drive away right now. Drive back to Scully and your X-Files and imminent death and I wouldn't be surprised if you did but I think you should take a look around. I mean, why leave something behind until you... until you know what it is you're leaving?

speaker: AGENT FLAGLER
line: Mulder was taken out of the hospital at just before It's her handwriting, she checked him out a.m.a; against medical advice. It's all legitimate, until you go to surveillance. This is the camera in the hall outside Mulder's room.

speaker: AGENT FLAGLER
line: Here's inside his room. And two other cameras on the ward. We're guesstimating there were at least three others involved. Check this out. Where's Waldo? She's talking to someone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I know who that is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello? Anybody home?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: They can change your name but they can't change the things you love.

speaker: MULDER
line: It can't be.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're dead.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: No. No, just really relaxed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully... saw you get shot... on the bridge six years ago. Sure, you're... dead.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: One, uh, well-placed bullet... A punctuation mark in a man's life and you get to start a whole new chapter. I'm fine, son. Aside from a little tennis elbow.

speaker: MULDER
line: I felt responsible for your death.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: You can let that go. Clearly, I'm alive.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought that you died for my quest.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Yes, along with Scully's sister and the man you thought was your father and Duane Barry and even Scully's mysterious illness and on and on and on. You can let go of all that guilt. I'm here to tell you that you're not the hub of the universe, the cause of life and death. We-- you and I-- we're... merely puppets in a master plan. No more, no less. You've suffered enough. Now you should enjoy your life. Let me show you something. That's my wife and daughters, we live just down the street. I hope... you'll visit us for dinner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, buddy, that's okay. You can build it again. Just start again. Okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's there? Who are you?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Hundreds of little joys-- to open a door and have a woman beckon you in, to have her make a fire and lay the table for you and when it's late, to feel her take you into her arms.

speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
line: This is Teena Mulder. I'm not in to take your call. Please leave your message.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Dana Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. As before, you can reach me at your son's office at the FBI. Thank you.

speaker: IS TITLED
line: "The Anasazi - An Entire Native American Indian Culture Vanishes Without a Trace - History as Myth and end of the world symbolism. Apocalypse and The Sixth Extinction." SCULLY stares at the book in awe.)

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, did you send me this book? SKINNER Excuse me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This book. It explains everything that I found in Africa... using the same symbols that I found on the ship.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, I asked you not to involve me in this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's all here, sir-- a foretelling of mass extinction; a myth about a man who can save us from it. That's why they took Mulder. They think that his illness is a gift-- protection against the coming plague.

speaker: SKINNER'S ASSISTANT
line: I'm sorry, Agent Scully. The Assistant Director has given me express orders not to let you in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir... Are you hurt? Are you cut? Get on the phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey! Stop that man!

speaker: MULDER
line: Morning.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: What's wrong, Fox?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's nothing wrong. Perfect. It's all perfect. What the hell am I doing here?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: You just need some coffee.

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I'm serious. I have commitments-- to the X-Files, to Scully, to my sister...

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: You think you know what that means... commitment. It's all just childish, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Childish"?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Yes. You've been a child... with only the responsibility of a child to your own dreams and fantasies but you won't know the true joy of responsibility until you plant your feet in the world... and become a father.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow... Diana, if... you lay all this on me after I sleep with you one time what's it going to be like tomorrow?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: You have to let go, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just like that? I'm just supposed to slip into domestic bliss even after I was dropped off here by a man I have every reason to believe left here to carry on his dirty work.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Hey... he lives the next block over. We'll go visit after breakfast.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You told someone, didn't you? You let the information out.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A man attacked Skinner in his office.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: For what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what he knows about Mulder.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I haven't told anyone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is this? These are mine. You've hacked into my files. What are you doing with these?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I was having them analyzed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By whom?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: National Institutes of Health.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: The material you have there-- encrypted data that describes advanced human genetics-- where did you get it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This was not supposed to go public.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Wherever you got it that data supports what's happened to Mulder. It proves what he's become-- biologically alien.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: What are you hiding?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It doesn't matter.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: It matters to someone. Whoever it is it sounds like they're looking for Mulder, too.

speaker: CSM
line: I wasn't expecting you so soon. I thought you'd take a few days to settle in.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I think you need to allay his unhappiness with things he perceives as left undone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, including why you live in a bigger house than I do.

speaker: CSM
line: I've got quite a few mouths to feed-- three grandkids... and, uh... your sister. She's been living here all along... living a life you'd forsaken.

speaker: SAMANTHA
line: He said you were coming.

speaker: CSM
line: A father has high hopes for his son but he never dreams his boy's going to change the world. I'm so proud of this man-- the depth of his capacity for suffering.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Like father, like son.

speaker: CSM
line: They think what he has is killing him but, in actuality, he's never been more alive.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Do you think he dreams?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm sure he dreams.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: About what, I wonder.

speaker: CSM
line: The dreams all men who are owned by the world have-- a simpler life... full of small pleasures. Extraordinary men are always most tempted by the most ordinary things. Dreams are all he has now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bum a cigarette, Agent Fowley?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I don't smoke.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Really? I could swear I smell cigarette smoke on you.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Let's cut the crap, shall we?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. Let's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Mulder?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Maybe before you go around blaming everyone you can find for what's happened to Mulder you could think about what you could've done to prevent it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just want you to think. Think of Mulder when you met him. Think of the promise and the life in front of him. Think of him now. And then try and stand there in front of me, look me in the eye and tell me Mulder wouldn't bust his ass trying to save you.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I'm thinking, Agent Scully. I'm always thinking.

speaker: PROJECT DOCTOR
line: It's a chance none of us ever expected... let alone hoped for. After all these years trying to develop a compatible alien-human hybrid and to have one ready-made.

speaker: CSM
line: All these years... all the questioning why... why keep Mulder alive? When it was so simple to remove the threat that he posed?

speaker: PROJECT DOCTOR
line: There was no way you could have predicted this.

speaker: CSM
line: The fact remains, he's become our savior. He's immune to the coming viral apocalypse. He's the hero here.

speaker: PROJECT DOCTOR
line: He may not survive the procedure.

speaker: CSM
line: Then he suffers a hero's fate.

speaker: MULDER
line: Diana?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Fox? It's time, honey.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Hey, how you doing?

speaker: CSM
line: Don't think of the man... Think of the sacrifice he's making for all of us... for the world.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: It would've been nice to give him a choice.

speaker: CSM
line: You don't think Mulder would've chosen this? To become the thing he sought for so long? To feel what it's like? He is what he sought.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: We'll never know.

speaker: CSM
line: Besides, his task is almost complete. I'll carry the burden from here on in.

speaker: CSM
line: I know about the boy. The boy on the beach. The vision you go to in your mind. We all have such places... born of memory and desire.

speaker: OLD MULDER
line: I've seen him thousands of times. I've never seen what he wants me to see.

speaker: CSM
line: Close your eyes. He's ready to show you if you're ready to see.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow. What did you make?

speaker: BOY
line: An unidentified flying object.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey! What are... what are you doing? Why are you destroying your spaceship?

speaker: BOY
line: It's your spaceship. You're destroying it. You were supposed to help me.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You're running out of time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why do you come to me like this? Why? When I can't find him.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You don't look in the right place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think you're hearing me.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You don't know where he is?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even if I did I wouldn't know how to save him. This science makes no sense to me.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Have you looked for him here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you asking me to pray?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: There are more worlds than the one you can hold in your hand.

speaker: CSM
line: I hope you see the poetry in this, Diana.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: You're removing genetic material that may kill your son.

speaker: CSM
line: We're forcing the next step in evolution to save man. We're doing God's work, Diana. Without this immunity, everyone would die. This knowledge is God's blessing. I'll carry on for Mulder from here.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Your patient's come out-- Mulder's awake.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: I've got him topped off, but he won't stay under.

speaker: DOCTOR 2
line: I don't think we can take him any further.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: Is he feeling any pain?

speaker: DOCTOR 2
line: Flat on the monitor. Any flatter, he'd be circling the drain.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: Okay... Let's do this thing.

speaker: CSM
line: Rest now.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Can you open the blind? I'd like to take a look outside.

speaker: CSM
line: I wanted you to have peace.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Where's Samantha?

speaker: CSM
line: Your sister died five years ago.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Where... What about Deep Throat?

speaker: CSM
line: We've been over this. He's dead. Diana's dead... and Scully.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Scully's dead?

speaker: CSM
line: She's dead.

speaker: CSM
line: It's time for you to let go. They're waiting for you... if you let go. Close your eyes, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: We're the last, you and I.

speaker: CSM
line: The end... and the beginning.

speaker: CSM
line: There's nothing to be done. Nothing at all.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Oh, Scully! I knew you'd come. They told me you were dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you believed them. Traitor.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Deserter. Coward.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Scully, don't... I'm dying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not supposed to die, Mulder-- not here.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not in a comfortable bed with the devil outside.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: No, you don't understand. He's taking care of me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, Mulder, he's lulled you to sleep. He's made you trade your true mission for creature comforts.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: There was no mission. There were no aliens.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No aliens. Have you looked outside, Mulder?

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: I can't. I'm... too tired.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, Mulder, you must get up. You must get up and fight... especially you. This isn't your place. Get up, Mulder. Get up and fight the fight.

speaker: VERY OLD MULDER
line: Scully... Where's Scully? Scully? Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. Mulder, you've got to wake up. I've got to get you out of here. Mulder, can you understand me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you've got to get up. I don't know how much time we have. You've got to get up, Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one can do it but you, Mulder. Mulder, help me. Please, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: You... help... me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, what are you doing here? Actually, I was just getting dressed to come see you but I... I couldn't find a tie to go with my victory cap.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, no work. You have to go back to bed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, wait. Tie goes to the runner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I, um... I was coming down... to work to tell you that Albert Hosteen is dead. He died last night in New Mexico. He'd been in a coma for two weeks. There was... no way he could have been in your apartment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was there-- we... we prayed together. Mulder, I don't believe that. I... I don't believe it. It's impossible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it any more impossible than what you saw in Africa or what you saw in me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what to believe anymore. Mulder, I was so determined to find a cure to save you that I could deny what it was that I saw and now I don't even know... I don't know... I don't know what the truth is... I don't know who to listen to. I don't know who to trust.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Diana Fowley was found murdered this morning. I never trusted her... but she helped save your life just as much as I did. She gave me that book. It was her key that led me to you. I'm sorry... I'm so sorry. I know she was your friend.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I was like you once-- I didn't know who to trust. Then I... I chose another path... another life, another fate, where I found my sister. The end of my world was unrecognizable and upside down. There was one thing that remained the same.

speaker: MULDER
line: You... were my friend, and you told me the truth. Even when the world was falling apart, you were my constant... my touchstone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you are mine.
